dt: {bc}a man belonging to a particular category (as by birth, residence, membership, or occupation)

dt.t: I now pronounce you {wi}man{/wi} and wife.

dt: {bc}a bipedal primate mammal ({it}Homo sapiens{/it}) that is anatomically related to the great apes but distinguished especially by notable development of the brain with a resultant capacity for articulate {dx_def}see {dxt|articulate:1||1a}{/dx_def} speech and abstract reasoning, and is the sole living representative of the {d_link|hominid|hominid:2} family
{bc}one possessing in high degree the qualities considered distinctive of manhood (such as courage, strength, and vigor)
{bc}the quality or state of being manly {bc}{sx|manliness||}
used as mode of familiar address
used interjectionally to express intensity of feeling
{bc}the individual who can fulfill or who has been chosen to fulfill one's requirements
{bc}the working force as distinguished from the employer and usually the management

dt.t: The {it}men{/it} have been on strike for several weeks.

dt: {bc}one of the distinctive objects moved by each player in various board games
{bc}one of the players on a team
{bc}an alumnus of or student at a college or university
{bc}the compound idea of infinite Spirit {bc}the spiritual image and likeness of God {bc}the full representation of Mind

dt.t: when I heard the siren, I knew it was the {it}Man{/it}
We should control anything that affects black people. Why should The {it}Man{/it} control us?

dt: {bc}one extremely fond of or devoted to something specified
{bc}with the agreement and consent of all {bc}{sx|unanimously||}

dt.t: He left home and moved to the city to become {it}his own man{/it}.
His friends, {it}to a man{/it}, supported him.

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}man, mon{/it} human being, male human; akin to Old High German {it}man{/it} human being, Sanskrit {it}manu{/it}
shortdef: an individual human; especially : an adult male human
a man belonging to a particular category (as by birth, residence, membership, or occupation) —usually used in combination

dt: {bc}a room equipped with one or more sinks, toilets, and usually urinals for the use of men and boys

shortdef: a room equipped with one or more sinks, toilets, and usually urinals for the use of men and boys

dt: used to say that someone who has been killed cannot reveal secret information

shortdef: —used to say that someone who has been killed cannot reveal secret information

meta.id: separate the men from the boys
stems: separate the men from the boys

hwi.hw: separate the men from the boys

dt: {bc}to show which people are really strong, brave, etc., and which are not

dt.t: Now that the competition gets tough it will {it}separate the men from the boys{/it}.

shortdef: to show which people are really strong, brave, etc., and which are not

dt: {bc}an employee who makes arrangements and handles publicity in advance of an appearance or engagement by the employer (such as a political candidate or a circus)

shortdef: an employee who makes arrangements and handles publicity in advance of an appearance or engagement by the employer (such as a political candidate or a circus)

dt: {bc}an outspoken critic of or protester against an economic condition or social injustice

{bc}one of a group of mid-20th century British authors whose works express the bitterness of the lower classes toward the established sociopolitical system and toward the mediocrity and hypocrisy of the middle and upper classes

shortdef: an outspoken critic of or protester against an economic condition or social injustice

one of a group of mid-20th century British authors whose works express the bitterness of the lower classes toward the established sociopolitical system and toward the mediocrity and hypocrisy of the middle and upper classes

dt: {bc}a primate (such as an australopithecine) intermediate in character between Homo sapiens and the higher apes

shortdef: a primate (such as an australopithecine) intermediate in character between Homo sapiens and the higher apes
the principal groomsman at a wedding
